sen.e: It is created in 1955 by Shuretsu MIYASHITA the first, a So player and composer, and improved by Shin MIYASHITA, his son.

sen.j: 30絃、全長235cm前後、最大幅55cm前後の大型の箏であり、可動フレットの不完全ツィターに属する。
sen.e: It is a large type of So with 30 strings and its size is around 235 centimeters in length and around 55 centimeter in maximum width, and it belongs to an incomplete zither with mobile frets.

sen.j: 従来の十三絃の箏の低音域と高音域を増大している。
sen.e: It is made to increase the low and high ranges of traditional jusan-genso (13-string Koto).
It is made to increase the low and high ranges of traditional Jusangen So (13-string Koto).

sen.j: 竜角からピンまでの間隔を長くし、そこの位置で絃を弾いたり（無調音）、打ったり（打音）できるように工夫され、打楽器的機能も備えている。
sen.e: The instrument is designed to extend the interval from the ryukaku (the fixed bridge on the performer's right) to pins and to have the function of percussion instruments so that a player can play strings (atonal) or beat (hit) there.

sen.j: 材質は従来の箏と同様で、各絃が頭部のピンに巻きつけられる点は、十七絃と同様である。
sen.e: Material of the instrument is the same as the traditional So and each string is twisted around a pin at the head portion just as jushichi-genso (17-string koto).
Material of the instrument is the same as the traditional So and each string is twisted around a pin at the head portion just as Jushichigen So (17-string Koto).

sen.j: 低音絃は極太（十七絃用より太い）を使用し、打楽器として手で力いっぱい叩いても十分耐えられるようにされている。
sen.e: The extra-thick strings (thicker than the strings for jushichi-genso) are used for tenor note strings and made strong enough for beating at full strength with a hand as percussive.

sen.j: 絃の太さは、3本単位ぐらいで変えられており、低音部17本は絹、高音部13本はテトロン製である。
sen.e: The thickness of the strings are changed in about threes of strings and 17 strings in the tenor note part are made of silk and 13 strings in the treble note part are made of tetrone.

sen.j: 箏柱は、全体的に大きく、最大例（低音部用）は総高8.5cm前後、最小例（高音部）は十七絃の箏柱に同じである。
sen.e: Bridges of koto are generally large and the largest one (for the tenor notes) is around 8.5 centimeter-high and the smallest one is the same as those of jushichi-genso.
